description: This is my adaptation of a Cornish Pasty.
name: Cornish Pasties Australian Style Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 5 small to medium potatoes, peeled and cubed
2 large wedges of queensland blue pumpkin, cubed
1 egg (to egg wash and seal the pastry)

recipeInstructions.text: Dice all your vegetables to the same size cubes and mix together with the minced beef, stock cubes or powder, salt and pepper and water.

I use an 18cm diameter saucepan lid to cut out my pastry. Place a large spoonful of the mixture into the center of the pastry and egg wash around half the pastry circle. Pull the edges together and seal. I crimp mine but it's up to you how you seal them.
Egg wash the pasties and place in an oven at 220 C for around 20-30 minutes or until the pastry is golden brown.

Depending on how much mixture you can get into the pasty, depends on how many you can make. I used a pack of 6 puff pastry sheets plus 2 extra that I had in the freezer. I cut 1 circle from each sheet and then re-roll the leftovers to best I can to get a few more out. I try not to use this as the pastry becomes a little bit tough and it's hard to get it thin enough. Today, I got 11 pasties and had mixture left over. If I had more puff pastry, I would have got another 4 pasties. It's trial and error.
